name: Colonist
uniques: Founds a new city <by consuming this unit>
Excess Food converted to Production when under construction

civilopediaText.text: 'The key to colonization is self-sufficiency.' - Qui-Gon Jinn
'The key to colonization is self-sufficiency.' - Qui-Gon Jinn

name: Great Artist
uniques: Empire enters a [8]-turn Golden Age <by consuming this unit>
Can instantly construct a [Landmark] improvement <by consuming this unit>

civilopediaText.text: Artists were individuals who created original works of art. In the days of the Galactic Republic, the Colonial Academy offered art classes. Following the rise of the Galactic Empire, Mandalorian artist and rebel Sabine Wren became notorious for painting rebellious graffiti as a form of propaganda. Chefs sufficiently skilled at cooking considered their work to be art.

name: Great Scientist
uniques: Can instantly construct a [Academy] improvement <by consuming this unit>

civilopediaText.text: 'A scientist must question—or be worth nothing.' - Vul Isen

name: Great Merchant
uniques: Can undertake a trade mission with City-State, giving a large sum of gold and [30] Influence
Can instantly construct a [Customs house] improvement <by consuming this unit>

civilopediaText.text: Merchants, also called traders, were people who sold and bought various products. Although some merchants did business legally, many did business illegally. Traders could also be adept at constructing a number of goods, including weapons, furniture, and droids. Traders who took part in constructing goods would occasionally specialize in a specific field, such as munitions, structures, domestic goods, or engineering.

name: Great Engineer
uniques: Can speed up construction of a building
Can instantly construct a [Manufactory] improvement <by consuming this unit>

civilopediaText.text: 'Sentient creatures can believe whatever they want—but too often they confuse their hopes and dreams with cold, hard reality. I don't have that luxury. As an engineer, I'm only concerned with what works.' - Kuat of Kuat

name: Great Prophet
uniques: Can instantly construct a [Holy site] improvement <by consuming this unit> <if it hasn't used other actions yet>
Can Spread Religion <for [2] movement> <[4] times> <after which this unit is consumed>
Removes other religions when spreading religion
May found a religion <by consuming this unit> <if it hasn't used other actions yet>
May enhance a religion <by consuming this unit>  <if it hasn't used other actions yet>
May enter foreign tiles without open borders
Takes your religion over the one in their birth city

civilopediaText.text: 'I am the Prophet. I speak the truth and foretell what is to come. I am not myself the key to redemption—I merely see it.' - Yu'shaa

name: Great Consular
uniques: Can undertake a trade mission with City-State, giving a large sum of gold and [30] Influence
Can instantly construct a [Holy site] improvement <by consuming this unit> <if it hasn't used other actions yet>
Can Spread Religion <[4] times> <after which this unit is consumed>
Removes other religions when spreading religion
May enter foreign tiles without open borders
Takes your religion over the one in their birth city

civilopediaText.text: 'A Consular is a specialized kind of Jedi. They focus more on cerebral Force skills. They're our healers, our researchers, our seers.' - Zayne Carrick

name: Great General
uniques: Empire enters a [8]-turn Golden Age <by consuming this unit>
[+15]% Strength bonus for [Military] units within [2] tiles
Can instantly construct a [Military Base] improvement <by consuming this unit>

civilopediaText.text: 'Soldiers win battles. Generals take credit.' - Kal Skirata

name: Monk
uniques: Can Spread Religion <for [4] movement> <[2] times> <after which this unit is consumed>
May enter foreign tiles without open borders, but loses [250] religious strength each turn it ends there
Can be purchased with [Faith] [in all cities in which the majority religion is a major religion]

civilopediaText.text: A monk was an individual who belonged to a religious community. Notable orders of monks included the B'omarr Order and the Arakein Monks. Because of the hooded robes they wore, the Jedi were sometimes compared to monks.

name: Inquisitor
uniques: Prevents spreading of religion to the city it is next to
Can remove other religions from cities <in [Friendly] tiles> <once> <after which this unit is consumed>
Can be purchased with [Faith] [in all cities in which the majority religion is a major religion]

civilopediaText.text: 'I know that treachery can break even the mightiest foe. And for those who study its secrets, the Force offers... unlimited power.' - Sith Inquisitor Kallig

name: Mobile Command Center
uniques: [+10]% Strength bonus for [Military] units within [2] tiles
Never appears as a Barbarian unit

civilopediaText.text: A mobile command center was a temporary prefabricated building used by the Galactic Empire for a variety of purposes, operating as a war room, barracks or mess halls. During the Empire's excavation of the Lothal Jedi Temple, several mobile command centers were used.

civilopediaText.name: Work Boats
uniques: May create improvements on water resources

civilopediaText.text: 'The key to colonization is self-sufficiency.' - Qui-Gon Jinn

civilopediaText.name: Scout
uniques: May upgrade to [Slugthrower] through ruins-like effects
Never appears as a Barbarian unit

civilopediaText.text: 'Our scout ships have reached Dantooine. They found the remains of a Rebel base, but they estimate that it has been deserted for some time. They are now conducting an extensive search of the surrounding systems.' - Siward Cass

civilopediaText.name: Warrior
uniques: May upgrade to [Beam-tuber] through ruins-like effects

civilopediaText.text: This is your basic, club-swinging fighter.

civilopediaText.name: Rakata Warrior
uniques: May upgrade to [Beam-tuber] through ruins-like effects

civilopediaText.text: Long ago the Rakata ruled all the known galaxy; all species bowed down to them - Keeper Orsaa

civilopediaText.name: Sith Pureblood Warrior
uniques: May upgrade to [Beam-tuber] through ruins-like effects

civilopediaText.text: The term Sith actually refers to a species of red-skinned beings who were native to Korriban. - Vestara Khai

In the light, there is a darkness and in the darkness, a light. It is the way with us all. Be a prisoner of neither Bogan nor Ashla. Strive to live in balance. As Tython itself teaches us, it is dangerous to do otherwise. And the danger is there—always. - Ketu
I am as I was made. Born to be a Force Hound. Fated to serve my masters. - Xesh
It's like a projectile from a slugthrower. Like someone whipped a rock real fast. - Joss Adren

civilopediaText.name: Star Lancer
uniques: Never appears as a Barbarian unit

civilopediaText.name: Ancient Artillery
uniques: Must set up to ranged attack
Never appears as a Barbarian unit

civilopediaText.text: ...and I've always said, if Exar Kun had artillery at Toprawa, your Jedi Chancellor would be sporting yellow eyes today. - Jarrow Rusher

civilopediaText.name: Ancient Starship
uniques: Never appears as a Barbarian unit

civilopediaText.text: From the earliest atomic rockets with primitive laser armaments, to Expansion Era cruisers such as the Gilagimar, to the Republic's battle vessels, to the amazing Super Star Destroyers of the Empire, ships have traded fire in the depths of space. - Unknown
